DataElement.preferredName: Treatment First Course Systemic Therapy Intervention or Procedure Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Date of initiation of systemic therapy that is part of the first course of treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Treatment First Course Systemic Therapy Intervention or Procedure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Systemic therapy that is part of the first course of treatment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:A period of protocol-prescribed activity or intervention.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
Passage through time; duration; a systematic or/and orderly succession; a sequence, e.g. course of treatment; a mode of action or behavior; natural development, typical manner of proceeding.

Property.preferredDefinition: (sis-TEM-ik) Affecting the entire body.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:A particular course of action intended to achieve a result.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredName: First Therapy Intervention or Procedure Date
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process._Activity or measure that produces an effect or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in patient or population. This is a general term encompassing medical, social, behavioral, environmental and other acts that can have preventive and/or therapeutic impact._a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen. [Explanatory Comment: Use a valid date or one of the permissible values listed.  Select Value Meaning as described in the NAACCR Data Dictionary, Eleventh Edition.]

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:A particular course of action intended to achieve a result.:a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences

ReferenceDocuments.name: RX Date--Systemic Description
ReferenceDocuments.description: Systemic therapy includes the administration of chemotherapy agents, hormone agents, biological response modifiers, bone marrow transplants, stem cell harvests, and surgical and/or radiation endocrine therapy. See page 97 for date format.

ReferenceDocuments.name: NAACCR 12.1, Data Stds/Dict.
ReferenceDocuments.description: For additional details see NAACCR, Standards for Cancer Registries Volume II, Version 12.1 Data Standards and Data Dictionary (6/2010)

ReferenceDocuments.description: For additional details see NAACCR, Standards for Cancer Registries Volume II, Version 16 Data Standards and Data Dictionary (01/2016)
